verses.verse: Concerning the ministering to God's people, it is really not necessary to write to you.
I know the eagerness of your mind, about which I brag about you to those of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago, and your zeal has motivated many.
Yet I have sent the brethren, fearing our boasting about you should be a waste of time in this sense, that, as I have said, that you are ready.
Otherwise if some Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we along with you would be ashamed at this same confident boasting.
Therefore I thought it necessary to encourage the brothers that they would go on ahead of you and prepare in advance your gift you promised, so that it might be ready as a gift not as greed.
But I [do say] this, "He who sows sparingly will harvest sparingly also," and "he who sows bountifully will harvest bountifully also."
Every one [needs to give] according as he decides in his heart, not grudgingly or because he has to, because God loves a cheerful giver.
God is also able to make every grace overflow to you, in order that you, always having everything sufficiently, may abound to every good work.
As it is written, "He has dispersed; He has given to the poor. His righteousness remains forever."
Now may He who supplies seed to the sower both give bread for [your] food and multiply your sown seed and increase the fruits of your righteousness
being enriched in every thing for every generosity, in that it brings about through us thanksgiving to God.
For the ministry of this service not only meets the need of God's people but also is abundant for many thanksgivings to God.
Through the approval of this ministry, they glorify God for your openly declared submission to Christ's gospel and for your generous sharing with them and to all.
In prayer for you, yearning for you for the surpassing grace of God on you.
Thanks to God for His unspeakable gift.
